title: Central Dogma, Protein Synthesis in Eukaryotes 2

content.description:
Directions: Answers must be in essay form. Outline form is not acceptable. Labeled diagrams may be used to supplement discussion, but in no case will a diagram alone suffice. It is important that you read each question completely before you begin

The flow of genetic information from DNA to protein in eukaryotic cells is called the central dogma of biology.
content.question: Cells regulate both protein synthesis and protein activity. Discuss TWO specific mechanisms of protein regulation in eukaryotic cells.

frqParts.text: Cells regulate both protein synthesis and protein activity. Discuss TWO specific mechanisms of protein regulation in eukaryotic cells.

skill.text: 1.C: Explain biological concepts and processes in applied contexts.
